DataElement.preferredName: Person Right Mid-Upper Arm Circumference Distance Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Measurement of the mid-upper right arm circumference at the mid-point between the tip of the shoulder and the tip of the elbow, aged 2 months and older.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Measurement of the mid-upper right arm circumference at the mid-point between the tip of the shoulder and the tip of the elbow, aged 2 months and older [Manually curated]

Property.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.:An intermediate part or section; an area that is approximately central within some larger region.:Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.:The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.:The length of the closed curve of a circle; the size of something as given by the distance around it.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
An intermediate part or section; an area that is approximately central within some larger region.
Higher in place or position; the topmost one of two.
The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.
The length of the closed curve of a circle; the size of something as given by the distance around it.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The space between two objects or points._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The space between two objects or points.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: The space separating two objects or points.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
